title: Geth macOS can never pass 3899354
body:
#### System information

Geth version: `geth version`
OS & Version: OSX 10.13 Beta (17A330h)
Commit hash : (if `develop`)

#### Expected behaviour

Geth synchronization should complete normally

#### Actual behaviour

Geth will never finish synchronizing, rejecting hash chains from this point forward.

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour

Start fresh telling geth to do a fast sync.

#### Backtrace

````
[backtrace]
````

Works fine for me.
command run:
$ cd ~/geth-darwin-amd64-1.6.7-ab5646c5/
$ ./geth

Geth/v1.6.7
MacOS High Sierra Version 10.13 Beta (17A330h)

please check:
- computer clock and timezone
- free space on disk

300GB of free space.  Mac Pro 2013/16GB/1TB/D500 FWIW.
On every start, Ethereum wallet warns me about clock sync, but it is synced.  I have tried toggling the system preference without effect, but I'll experiment some more.
I have nuked the ~/Library/Ethereum/geth/chaindata folder and restarted a couple times without a change.  I have just removed the entire ~/Library/Ethereum/ and restarted again because I think I might know what is happening.  It is at block ~780000 now.

Ok it stalled for 45 minutes at block 4140932, so I restarted it a few times and on the third attempt it finally finished up.  Compared to the Windows 10 x64 machine sitting right next to it on the desk it took an incredibly long time.

As for it being stuck at 3899229, I think I know what happened.  After I started it up and let it sync the first time, and populated 0.25ETH into the wallet that I generated, I put a small transaction into place from one wallet address into another.  At the time I did it, I think geth was stalled, or had lost its internet connectivity.  I believe I quit and restarted after a while.  My guess is that  it would never accept 3899229 from other nodes because it was missing that 0.25ETH transaction that it expected.  By nuking the entire ~/Library/Ethereum/, that road block got cleared.  So perhaps there is either a transaction state management or garbage collection issue.

Addendum: After importing the keys for the wallet from the stalled setup, I see that the transaction actually did occur, but ethereum wallet on macOS never reflected it until I nuked the setup and let it resync with the network.
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions.
